column4: Hey all. I'm running dual monitors in ubuntu with ATI catalyst. When I click to maximize a youtube video, it maximizes it onto the other screen. Thoughts?
thank you sir. where can i get it?
FlashHacker is actually a Windows fix for it, but I'm assuming there's one for linux.
right. im using chrome. does that make a diff?
there is a separate one for chrome on windows, but not sure about linux.
I'm not sure if that's the answer..
actually lemme first see if i have this problem in FF. i just hate FF, i prefer chrome
I don't know if a solution exists tbh now.
google around for it is all I can suggest.

strange, i think its a monitor issue bc if i have the video playing on my left monitor and i click to maximize it maximizes on that monitor. its only when im playing on right monitor that it pushes it to the right monitor in fullscreen.
http://goo.gl/BFVGS should i try some of those solutions?
you can, but I would personally google around, I haven't fixed it in linux only in windows.
